unit: Unit 6 | Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions
title: Sample Size and Significance: Who Has the Smallest Power?
question_text: In a hypothesis test, ${ H }_{ 0 }:p=0.75$ versus ${ H }_{ a }:p<0.75$, the power of the test $p=0.75$ would be the smallest for which of the following choices of sample size $n$ and significance level $\alpha$ ?

choices.text: The answer cannot be determined from the information given.

solution:
Power is the probability of correctly rejecting the null hypothesis.

Power will be smallest when the significance level is the smallest, as the null hypothesis will have a higher probability of being rejected. Since we want the smallest power, we want the smallest significance level. Choices 'B' and 'D' can be eliminated with significance levels of $\alpha=0.05$.

Regarding the sample size, the power will be the smallest when the sample size is the smallest. The reason for this is with a smaller sample size we will be less likely to correctly reject the null hypothesis. Choices 'C' and 'E' can be eliminated with larger sample sizes or assuming not enough information was provided

Thus, our answer is Choice 'A'.
